page.title: 18Fight to save Weston School
page.content:
In both 1981 and 1984 local parents mounted campaigns to save the{Village {School}from closure by Oxfordshire County Council due to falling rolls. The threat to the stone and thatch school where Weston children had been educated for over 130 years roused strong feelings in the community on both occasions. This was reflected in packed village meetings and noisy {demonstrations}in Oxford.
In 1981 parents argued successfully that the cost of bussing children to another school would hardly undercut that of keeping Weston School open. By 1984 the number of pupils had drop- ped from 23 to 9 and it was considered unlikely to rise above 20 in the fore- seeable future. Following the retire- ment of the Head Teacher the school was closed in December 1984.
